newsitem.title: JORDAN: Bank gains help push up Jordanian stock index.
newsitem.headline: Bank gains help push up Jordanian stock index.

text.p: A slight rise in heavily traded shares of Jordan Gulf Bank nudged Jordan's stock exchange index upwards on Saturday but brokers reported little activity on the bourse and most stocks eased.

Jordan Gulf Bank shares rose just 0.01 dinars to 0.87 dinars in turnover of 165,000 dinars ($233,000), or more than a quarter of Saturday's overall turnover. Brokers said much of that came in a single bloc transaction of Jordan Gulf shares.
The bank's modest rise helped push the official Amman Financial Market (AFM) index up 0.09 points to 156.91 points in turnover of 551,000 dinars.
Brokers say the bank issued a statement last week to reassure investors after traders started fretting over large quantities of Jordan Gulf stock coming onto the market.
Arab Bank shares also rose 1.50 dinars to 266.50 dinars on Saturday and Middle East Investment Bank rose 0.02 dinars to 1.07 dinars.
But falling shares outnumbered gainers by 21 to nine, with another 11 trading but closing unchanged.
"There was little activity from outside investors today," broker Hussam Hanbali said. "Turnover was weak and it was all local buying."
The private Pearl Index of the 45 most-traded shares on the exchange shed 0.08 percent to 82.44 points.
